result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Nicholas S Werling in court.  Attorney Mark D. Richards in court for Nicholas S Werling.  Attorney Chad Wozniak in court for State of Wisconsin.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Level 5 Supervision with Electronic monitoring incompliance with Rock County and Milwaukee County. If an Electronic Monitoring Device (GPS) is unavailable and Cash Bail has been paid, Defendant to be released and placed on the Electronic Monitoring (GPS) waiting list.  Curfew 6pm-6am. No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms. No contact order remain the same.

Defendant Nicholas S Werling appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Mark D. Richards in court for Nicholas S Werling.  Attorney Chad Wozniak in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for Arraignment. Original Information received and e-filed.  Defense acknowledges receipt, waives reading, and enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of defendant. Defense has NOT received discovery material from the State. Defense requested Status hearing. Case adjourned for Status hearing. Case remains calendared in Branch 2. Status hearing scheduled for October 3, 2022 at 8:30 am. Hearing will be held Via Zoom Video Conference.
Status conference scheduled for October 3, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Level 5 Supervision with Electronic Monitoring.  If electronic monitoring device is unavailable and cash bail has been paid, bail to revert to $1,000,000.00.  If Alternative bail is paid, Defendant to be released and placed on Electronic Monitoring waiting list. Must contact JusticePoint within 24 hours of being released from custody. Not to be within 500 feet of any schools. Limited Curfew, must be in residence daily from 6pm until 6am. No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Nicholas S Werling in court with attorney Haley E Wentz.  Defendant Nicholas S Werling in custody.  Chad Wozniak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Nicholas S Werling appeared by video means with Attorney. Case retabbed due to nature of the case. Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Childs, Branch 02.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL. This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 23, 2022 at 10:00 am.
